Key Arguments: The proposed legislation infringes on the human right to freedom of opinion and expression as outlined in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
The legislation is seen as invalid and illegal because it overrides basic human rights.
The legislation is perceived as collectivist and suppressive of contrary opinions.
It is believed that the legislation will undermine free speech and the foundations of Australian democracy.
Notable Quotes: "Everyone has the right to freedom of opinion and expression; this right includes freedom to hold opinions without interference and to seek, receive and impart information and ideas through any media and regardless of frontiers."
"I consider that such legislation, if passed into law, would be both invalid and illegal, given it overrides basic human rights."
"The philosophy behind the proposed legislation is collectivist in nature and actively deprecates the rights of those with contrary opinions."
